story.title: Puppy Love - Episode 1
story.storyDescription: Hanna takes one last look around the back office of her father’s veterinary clinic.
story.creator: web-uploader

messages.text: Hanna takes one last look around the back office of her father’s veterinary clinic.
She’s checked off everything on her to do list for the night…
So she locks the door and heads out into the waiting room.
But she stops short when she sees a guy, about her age, bent over the puppy pen.
He’s scratching the face of a buff-colored lab that’s up for adoption.
Can I help you?
He jerks upright at the sound of her voice.
No. I was, uh, I was just looking.
He’s gorgeous, with dirty blond hair and chocolate brown eyes.
Sorry, it looks like you’re closing up. I’ll go.
Hanna rushes around the counter.
No, you don’t have to—
Puppies need lots of attention. I’m glad you’re giving her some.
One corner of his lips twitch up into a short-lived grin…
Before he bends back over to take the puppy out of the large pen.
Do you like dogs?
Hanna smiles as she leans over the counter, closer to him.
I do. They’re my favorite.
Labs are really good ones, too.
They are. She’d be a great pet if you were in the market.
I wish I was, but…
Parents said no?
Yeah, that’s part of it.
Maybe if you showed them a picture of her they’d change their mind.
That’s how my friend convinced her parents to get a dog.
I’m Hanna by the way.
He looks up from petting the puppy to smile at her.
Hanna’s heart skips a beat.
This guy is undeniably cute, but there’s a hint of sadness around his eyes…
And in his smile.
I’m Cole. Nice to meet you.
Do you go to school around here?
We just moved here. I start at Northridge High in the fall.
That’s where I go. I’ll be a junior.
I’ll be a senior.
They both fall silent. Hanna watches him gently pet the puppy.
Ar-are you okay?
Cole’s soft brown eyes slide up to Hanna’s.
Sure, yeah. I’m fine. Why?
Hanna glances down toward her toes, awkwardly tucking a strand of hair behind her ear.
I don’t know. I don’t even know why I asked.
Nosy much, Hanna?
She breathes a self-deprecating laugh.
I didn’t think you were being nosy.
Cole shrugs.
Just trying to figure out why you asked.
Hanna twists her mouth, considering her words before she speaks.
I guess I asked because you seem…sad.
Sorry. I…
Cole sighs.
We had to leave our dog behind when we moved.
I didn’t realize how much I’d miss him.
I’m sorry.
It’s bad enough that I had to change schools my senior year—
But trust me, this makes it a whole lot worse.
I can’t imagine. That’s gotta be rough.
Yeah. I had to leave my friends, my school, my dog. My whole life.
I don’t really want to be here, but…
It would help to have a friendly face around, ya know?
I totally get that.
Cole strokes the puppy’s tiny head.
She nods off in Cole’s arms.
I think she likes you.
Cole smiles down at the puppy, but then he looks up—
And straight into Hanna’s eyes as he answers.
The feeling is mutual.
Hanna clears her throat. She points to the puppy.
She’s been here almost two weeks.
She’s the last of her litter.
Cole frowns.
Doesn’t anyone want her?
We sometimes have a harder time adopting out females.
What will happen to her?
Hanna’s heart melts at the mixture of horror and hurt on his face.
I guess I’ll keep her if no one wants her.
Here? You’ll keep her here?
No, we have a farm on the outskirts of town. I’ll take her home with me.
Hanna watches as various emotions flit across Cole’s handsome face.
Concern, thoughtfulness…and finally resolve.
Would you need any help taking care of her?
Excitement unfurls in Hanna’s stomach.
You mean you? You’d want to help take care of her?
Yeah, sure.
I’d take her if I could, but since I can’t, maybe we could share her.
I’d like that.
Hanna looks to the puppy, who’s curled into Cole’s chest.
I think we both would.
Suddenly nervous, Hanna nibbles at her bottom lip with her teeth.
Um, I’m getting ready to take her for her walk.
Do you want to come?
Cole doesn’t answer right away.
He just watches her with his warm eyes.
Hanna starts to nervously backpedal.
I mean, you probably already have plans. I just thought—
Cole’s very kissable lips spread into a bright smile.
It makes Hanna’s heart melt.
I’d love to.
Relieved, Hanna excuses herself to get the leash.
When the puppy is hooked up, Hanna hands the leash to Cole and opens the door for them.
They both laugh when the puppy takes off through the opening.
She loves her walks. Can you tell?
Little bit.
They walk in silence for a few minutes as the puppy sniffs along the edge of the sidewalk.
So, you’ll be a junior, huh? Any tips for going to school around here?
Hanna slowly shakes her head as she ponders his question.
Not that I can think of.
It’s as boring as every other high school in America, I guess.
There isn’t much to this town.
Doesn’t look boring to me.
Hanna shifts her gaze left to find Cole smiling over at her.
Heat floods her cheeks.
It has its moments.
Like right now, she thinks.
Cole stares at her for several long, intense seconds before looking away.
He clears his throat.
So, what about you? How long have you lived around here?
Born and raised.
Lots of friends, I’m guessing?
Hanna shrugs.
The normal amount, I guess.
What about a boyfriend?
Not at the moment.
Cole nods.
Bad break up?
Hanna doesn’t want to go into the gory details.
Besides, her break up with the school jock suddenly seems like a distant memory…
Now that she’s standing beside Cole.
Not too bad. I sort of saw it coming so that helped.
We didn’t have anything in common.
I guess I should say I’m sorry.
You guess?
Well, it would seem insensitive to say that I’m happy you broke up.
Hanna feels her cheeks flush in anticipation.
I wouldn’t necessarily say that.
In that case, I’m really happy you broke up.
A laugh escapes Hanna.
And why is that?
It would really suck to move to a new town and find out the first girl I like is taken.
Smothering her grin, Hanna plays dumb.
I told you no one had adopted her yet.
Cole laughs outright.
The sound is rich and deep, and brings chills to Hanna’s arms.
Oh, so you’re being coy now?
Hanna keeps her face blank.
You said the girl you liked. I just assumed…
Cole stops and turns to face Hanna.
Let me be more direct then.
The girl I meant is you.
I like you, Hanna.
Hanna can’t hide her smile now.
I’d like to take you out sometime.
Without the dog.
I think I could arrange something.
Could you arrange something Friday night?
I’ll see what I can do.
In the meantime, you can come over tomorrow and help me walk the dog.
If you want, that is.
I do want that, very much.
They resume walking, a comfortable silence falling between them.
Suddenly, Cole stops.
Thank you.
For what?
This is the best day I’ve had in a while.
Seeing the sadness fade from Cole’s eyes has Hanna’s heart near bursting.
And besides, it turns out today is one of the best days Hanna has had in a while, too.
